intro: Lampranthus prasinus, commonly known as the green ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant features dense clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted for storing water in arid environments. Lampranthus prasinus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
